    import Executable from 'mcpyver/src/executables/executable.js'
    public class | source

    Executable

    Direct Subclass:

    CondaExecutable, JupyterExecutable, PipExecutable, PythonExecutable, VirtualEnvExecutable

    A specific file on a computer that can be run

    Static Public Members

    public static get searchPaths: string[] source

    Paths to manually search in for executables

    Static Public Methods

    public static findAll(command: string | string[]): Promise<ExecutableCollection> source

    Given a command name or list of commands, returns an ExecutableCollection of all the executables with that name your computer might know about Looks in the path as well as looking in common paths. The Executables are all merged together, so you don't have different symlinks pointing at the same file. Each actual binary file yields one Executable

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    command string | string[]

    the command or a list of commands

    Return:

    Promise<ExecutableCollection>

    the discovered executables

    public static findAllWithoutMerge(command: string): Promise<ExecutableCollection> source

    Given a command name or list of commands, returns an ExecutableCollection of all the executables with that name your computer might know about Looks in the path as well as looking in common paths. The Executables are not merged Each path yields one Executable

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    command string

    the command

    Return:

    Promise<ExecutableCollection>

    the discovered executables

    public static findByPaths(command: string): Promise<ExecutableCollection> source

    Manually searches paths to find executables with a given name

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    command string

    the command

    Return:

    Promise<ExecutableCollection>

    the found executables

    public static findByWhich(command: string): Promise<ExecutableCollection> source

    Uses which to find all of the paths for a given command

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription

    the command

    Return:

    Promise<ExecutableCollection>

    the found executables

    public static findOne(command: *): Promise<Executable> source

    Given a command name, creates an Executable from the executable file that would have been run had you typed the command in (e.g. which)

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    command *

    Return:

    Promise<Executable>

    the discovered executable

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    path string

    the full path to the binary

    a command that executes this file
    isDefault boolean

    whether the command is first in the PATH

    TODO:

    • I think this only exists because of legacy, should probably get rid of it and replace with examining defaultCommands instead

    public get mergeField: string: string source

    When merging an ExecutableCollection, this is what you group the executables by. Mostly exists because PipExecutable on Windows has different paths but point to the same package install directory, which makes them equivalent.

    Return:

    string

    the value that makes the executable unique

    public mtime: * source

    public get path: string: string source

    When you're looking for a path, but don't necessarily care if it's the symlinked one or the non-symlinked on?

    Return:

    string

    the best known path for the executable

    TODO:

    • it says 'FIXME' but I think it should just be 'get rid of me'

    public version: string source

    Public Methods

    public addCommand(command: string) source

    Add a command that this executable is first in line for, e.g. if you run blahblah from the shell this executes

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    command string

    public addError(error: Error) source

    Take any rescued error and attach it to the object, e.g. pass errors from the command line to the end user

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    error Error

    an error object, typically rescued from elsewhere

    public abstract setExtras(): Promise source

    Subclasses that need extra details (lists of packages, etc) override this method

    Return:

    Promise

    public setRawVersion(version: string) source

    Given a version-y string, do slight cleanup and set the executable's rawVersion. Typically comes from stdout/stderr.

    Params:

    NameTypeAttributeDescription
    version string

    the version string, fresh from terminal output
